intro: Polybotrya sorbifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance contribute to its appeal in horticulture.
